38233424.review:
플레이시간 : 약 2시간

평가 : 5/10

요약평 : 적고 다양하지 않은 스테이지가 아쉽고, 퍼즐을 풀 때 당황스러울 때가 있지만, 한번 해볼만함



1. 플레이 방식

물리법칙을 토대로 하여 지형지물과 제공되는 압정, 지우개를 사용하여 파란색 타겟(원, 사각형)을 목표지점까지 도달시키면 됩니다.



2. 난이도

난이도 자체는 좀 높은 편이라고 생각합니다.(힌트를 쓰지 않을 경우)

처음부터 머리를 쓰기보다는 일단 박치기를 해가며 퍼즐을 풀어가야 했으며,

박치기를 하는 도중 클리어가 되어버리는 경우도 종종 있었습니다.

또한 물리엔진에 대해서 잘 모르긴 합니다만, 같은 방법을 똑같이 해도 어떨 때는 이렇게 작동하고, 어떨 때는 저렇게 작동하기 때문에 

당혹스러울 경우가 많습니다.


프로젝트가 종합편과 컨셉편으로 나누어져 있으며,

특히 좌상단의 세부프로젝트 제목자체가 꽤나 큰 힌트를 제공해줍니다.

때문에 명확히 나와있는 컨셉편이 종합편보다 훨~씬 쉽습니다.

또한 스테이지를 깰 때마다 1개씩 제공되는 힌트 1, 2개만으로도 난이도가 많이 낮아집니다.

그리고 목표지점에 완벽히 안 들어가고 일부만 들어가도 엥간하면 다 될만큼 판정도 널널합니다.




3. 편의성

기본적인 좌클릭은 당연한 거고,

압정과 지우개는 좌상단에서 드래그 해서 사용할 수도 있고, 

압정은 우클릭, 지우개는 가운데클릭로도 조작이 가능하게 만들었습니다만....

압정, 지우개보다도 많이 사용하는 것이 되돌리기(undo), 초기화(reset)인데 이건 구현이 안 되어 있는 것 같습니다.

그냥 키보드까지 사용할 수 있게 만들어줬거나 아예 미구현할 것이었으면 있는 사람이라도 사용하라고

5버튼 마우스용으로 되돌리기, 초기화를 만들어줬으면 하는 아쉬움이 남았습니다.

생각보다 동선이 길어서 불편합니다.


또한 힌트는 무조건 맨처음부터 알려주기 때문에 마지막 부분만 알면 될 것 같은데 해도 처음부터 보셔야 합니다.

옆사람이 보고 그건 대충 요렇게 해봐 하는 것처럼, 현재 진행상황을 보고 힌트를 제공해주진 않습니다.
(하긴 이정도급 게임에서 그렇게까지 바라는 건 좀....)

퍼즐을 해결하는 방법은 한 가지가 아닌데 주는 힌트가 지금 풀고 있는 방법에 적용이 안 되어서 아예 노선을 바꾸어야 하는 경우도 발생합니다.



3. 기타

거슬리지 않는 BGM도 괜찮았고,

낙서한듯한 배경과 그래픽은 나쁘게 말하면 참 성의없다라고 생각할 수도 있겠습니다만, 저에겐 오히려 호감으로 다가왔습니다.

화려하다고 만사가 아니라는 걸 다시금 느꼈습니다.



4. 평가

그래픽과 가격을 보고 가벼운 마음으로 시작했습니다만 나름 머리를 많이 써야했습니다.

간단간단히 쉬는 시간에 해야지 하기에는 좀 어렵고, 마음잡고 해야지 하기에는 좀 쉽고 그러네요.
(물론 몇몇 스테이지는 아니었습니다만...)

다만 제가 퍼즐을 처음에 고심하고 풀고, 막히면 다시 고심하고, 이래도저래도 안 되면 그제서야 박치기 하는 스타일로 푸는 것을 좋아해서 그런지

거의 처음부터 박치기를 하고, 다시 되돌리고 이런 건 좀 불호로 다가올 때가 있었습니다.

솔직히 나이가 적으나 많으나 일단 박치기를 해야하기 때문에 클리어 시간이 막 그렇게 큰 차이가 나고 그러진 않을 것 같아요.

좀 더 스테이지가 다양하고 많았다면 출시된지 시간이 꽤 지난 지금도 충분히 제값 주고 살 가치가 있었을 거라고 생각합니다.

번들에선 주게임으로 보기에는 플레이시간도 짧고 가볍습니다만, 한번 해볼만한 가치는 있다고 생각합니다.

33400597.review:
A random picker told me to play this game and I'm glad it did.

I should probably start this review by saying I seldom choose to play any type of puzzler game as they have a habit of angering rather than entertaining however this game was great fun.

The puzzles range in difficulty and are built around different core mechanics, this means that even if your way of thinking isn't well suited to one type of puzzle you may find that you excel in others and you are not forced to stick to a single puzzle until you solve it which is often where my anger lies with puzzler games.

The art is minimalistic which is fits with the simplicity of the game design and the music is acceptable but does get repetitive.

My main critique is the fact that I cant ADJUST the volume of the music, it can only be turned on or off.

If you are reading this and deciding whether to buy it then do, even if you don't normally enjoy puzzlers normally you are getting a great game for a price i'd consider below its actual value.

31308862.review:
TransPlan es un magnífico juego indie de lógica o puzles donde debemos llevar una caja de un punto A a un punto B, por medio de las leyes de la física, usando catapultas, rampas, etc., que nosotros mismo tendremos que formar con las piezas que nos ofrece en cada plano o proyecto. 

Cada acertijo tiene (como en el Golf) un número de "golpes" (movimientos) par, lo cual también está muy bien para darle ese toque de competitividad. Por otro lado los proyectos están dibujados a mano de una manera simple pero muy efectiva para lo que demanda el juego.

La dificultad es progresiva, empieza muy fácil y acaba bastante difícil (afortunadamente por cada proyecto concluído con éxito vamos ganando puntos, que podemos usar para pedir valiosas pistas).

En conclusión, para todo aquel que disfrute con los juegos de lógica o puzles TransPlan es un título imprescindible.

26218495.review: Pretty fun physics puzzle game, although not without flaws. The problem is that the behaviour of elements is nondeterministic, which is especially visible when you use undo and end up in a completely different situation than before the last action (most notably, blocks lose any momentum they may have had). Sometimes it helps to solve puzzles, sometimes it's a nuisance - one can only wonder if it's an intended behaviour or poor programming. Overall, though, it provides 2-3h of solid entertainment, so worth a try.

24350586.review:
doiron5's negative review precisely summarizes my complaints about the game, so just read that.

tl;dr the main dealbreaker is the physics, which is:

1) non-intuitive, e.g., if I drop a block on a catapult, the payload flies far, but if instead I drop TWO blocks, somehow the blocks drop slower (wt* gravity plz?) and the payload flies less far.

2) non-deterministic, i.e., if you perform the same action from the same state, the outcome could be different, so for every failed approach, you'd actually have to try a few times to be sure that it's really not working, and not just bad luck.

Half the puzzles also feel like "can you mindread the level designer" challenges.

24210294.review:
どんなゲーム？：
設計図風の画面上で青いオブジェクトを薄い青い部分で止めたらクリア
白の軽いブロック、ちょっと重い灰色のブロック、完全固定の黒ブロックと
クリックで落とす、右クリックでブロックを消す、ピン留めで固定するというシンプルな要素とアクションでパズルを解いていく

いい点：シンプルで動画のようなのんびりとしたＢＧＭでパズルを楽しめるヒント回数は豊富に手に入り、使いやすい。
いきなり全部の回答ではなく、小出しにみることもできる
物理演算的なシステムとリアルタイムでボールが転がったりするのでアクション的な部分も楽しめる
さながら積み木で遊ぶような感覚でごり押しでも可能
青いブロックの軌跡は残るので調整しやすい

悪い点：
一手前に戻す機能があるが、たまに転がっていたボールが途中でとまったりと挙動がおかしいときがある
パズルリストがチャート式なので途中から再開する場合は探しづらい


その他
ステージ数は７０ぐらいなので値段相応
実績全解除もヒントのおかげでやりやすい
日本語化も設定できるが文字サイズとフォントが微妙。ゲーム的にも必要は無いが、ステージタイトルはヒントになるので設定してもいいかも
実績に規定数より少ないというのもあるので要チェック

総評：
値段も安く、手軽に楽しめるパズルものとしておすすめ。リトライしやすく考えるのが楽しくなると思います。

画面上のオブジェクトを操作して、青色のオブジェクトを指定したエリアに移動する物理演算パズルゲーム。ヒント使用ありでオールクリアまでのクリア時間は3時間程度。

「じっくり腰を据えて取り組む」というタイプではなく、どちらかというと「空いた時間に起動してパッとやめられる」タイプのゲームですね。

難易度は易しめです。クリア判定もそれほど厳密でなく、「これしか指定のエリアに入ってないけど大丈夫かな？」という状況は大体クリアになります（笑）
どうしても解けない問題に遭遇しても、ヒントトークンを使って手順のヒントを知ることができます。
（※獲得できるヒントトークンはゲームを通して有限なので、使いすぎに注意！）

難点を挙げるとするなら、物理演算を利用しているという特性上、同一手順で操作を行ってもオブジェクトの動きが異なる結果になってしまって解法を再現できない場合があることでしょうか。一度のトライで失敗したからといって諦めず、何度も試行してみる根気も必要となるでしょう。

22682653.review:
Simple to learn physics puzzle game. The puzzles started out really cool at the beginner and intermediate levels. Many of the expert puzzles were fun as well, but later on in the game it seemed like many of my solutions were more trial and error than planning, and it felt like brute force was almost encouraged because it works so well for some puzzles. 

The music is nice, but it does get repetitive fast. The art style is nice too with everything being hand-drawn. 

Ultimately this game was a good experience, but the longevity is very weak. I would enjoy if there was some online solution implementation involved in order that you could try to beat others times. The recommended steps to solve a puzzle were often many more steps than needed, so it would nice to see what other users have had as a minimum amount of steps for a more legitimate challenge. 

Ultimately, I'd recommend this if you enjoy physics puzzles, but you should know going into this that the game is short.

A casual puzzler, with clean graphics/interface and a chilled mood. TransPlan promotes playing around and iterating towards a solution.

The projects/levels are not too numerous, but the game (bought for less than 1€) delivers a solid fun/price-ratio.
If one uses no hints (strongly advised to try without!!!), the game can be finished in 2-3 hours... without being repetetive at all.

Minor point: the physic-engine seems a bit "touchy", meaning: tiny variations can lead to very different results.
And the game will not help you towards a good outcome, but will do what the engine dictactes.
As a result, TransPlan can feel odd sometimes, as trying to repeat a previous setup might end with a different outcome.
On the good side: trying to play with timing and variations, one can beat some levels waaaay below the "par".

19527743.review: TransPlan – незамысловатая головоломка, на основе физики (проблемы недетерминированности симуляции практически не встречаются). Задача игрока: доставить синюю фигуру в соответствующую зону. В нашем арсенале всего три различных действий: активировать объект, после чего на него начинает действовать сила тяжести; удалить объект и закрепить объект канцелярской кнопкой. Из этих несложных вариантов (последние два необязательно доступны в каждой головоломке) и складывается весь геймплей. Удивительно, но таких простых элементов хватает на несколько десятков задачек. Они не трудные, разбиты по темам и возрастающей сложности. Лишь «Мастерский» блок может доставить проблемы, впрочем, за прохождение каждого уровня дается возможность посмотреть подсказку. В итоге игра спокойно проходится за один вечер. Радует также наличие русской локализации, хотя из-за отсутствия сюжета перевод нужен разве что меню. В целом: 7,5/10.

17938542.review:
Fun little physics puzzle game. Your goal is to get a blue square or circle to a blue area to complete each puzzle. Items start stationary but when you click on them gravity is activated and the blocks will move accordingly.

You're given two tools to complete your tasks wtih; an eraser and thumbtacks. The eraser will let you get rid of undesirable blocks and the tacks can go in slots to make the block pivot around that spot.

Using these tools, you'll make catapaults, swings and other interesting tools to help you throw blocks around in ways that would give Newton a boner.

The graphics are pretty minimalistic, it's all done on graph paper and with pencil, so it's still aesthetically pleasing.

The music I really enjoyed, just simple playful little tunes that will have you unashamedly bobbing while you sling blocks around. 

The overall theme of the game is simplicity hiding some pretty complex features.

It will only take a few hours to complete. The game isn't super challenging, but it will make you think a bit. Definitely worth a playthrough

17777211.review:
[table][tr][td][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/MentorPixel]Mentor Píxel[/url] – [i]El medio interactivo como entretenimiento inteligente[/i][/td][/tr][/table]

[h1][b]TransPlan – Jugando a las físicas con papel y lápiz[/b][/h1]

[b][i]TransPlan[/i][/b] es un juego de puzles con un concepto minimalista, estética agradable y jugabilidad sólida. Quienes se sean afines a las mecánicas de física, este título tiene el potencial de ofrecerá horas de diversión si las expectativas se mantienen al ras.

[h1]Papel, lápiz y un piano[/h1]
El concepto de [b][i]TransPlan[/i][/b] es el de llevar al jugador a experimentar con proyectos de física en un borrador, por eso veremos que el título está presentado por una estética de lápiz y papel, significando planos hechos a mano.

La música consiste en unas cuantas pistas lideradas por piano, estas se repiten inadvertidamente a lo largo del juego según en la instancia o nivel en la que nos encontramos. La falta de variedad de música puede ser sin duda un punto débil, pero estos piezas musicales no llegan a hacer en ningún momento tediosas o repetitivas, son por el contrario bastante agradables, considerablemente relajante y en definitiva le van a bien al estado de ánimo que la temática de la jugabilidad demanda. Los efectos de sonido, por otro lado, son de decente calidad y de ejecución satisfactoria.

[h1]El menú de selección de nivel: un puzle[/h1]
El aspecto más antagónico del juego en cuanto a diseño es sin duda la estructura de selección de niveles. Probablemente porque su filosofía de diseño haya sido concebirla como un puzle en sí mismo. Este tiene forma de árbol y cada reglón de niveles desbloquea los subsiguientes a los que estén enlazados, sin embargo no podremos ver el mapa de niveles como un todo y para desplazarnos debemos ir de instancia a instancia. Debido a su innecesaria complejidad, nos sentiremos perdidos cuando queramos ubicarnos en el árbol y seleccionar un determinado reglón, por lo que el jugador tendrá que adaptarse y familiarizarse con la secuencia y las relaciones de los niveles para determinar su progreso.

El resto de la interfaz es bastante sencilla e intuitiva. Esto no nos causará ningún inconveniente a la hora de resolver los rompecabezas que nos plantea cada nivel ya que su jugabilidad demanda un diseño minimalista para la interacción del usuario.

[h1]Un softcore de los juegos de física[/h1]
En [b][i]TransPlan[/i][/b] el objetivo es hacer llegar el objeto A al punto B con ciertos bloques como obstáculos, deberemos moverlos y utilizarlos a nuestro favor para nuestro fin, creando rampas, catapultas y rigiéndonos por las leyes de la física. Nuestras herramientas serán un borrador y un alfiler de pizarra.

En nuestros desafíos constaremos con movimientos ilimitados, sin embargo en cada nivel el juego nos marcará con una cantidad de movimientos ideales para completar nuestros objetivos; si así lo hacemos, habremos completado eficientemente la instancia y desbloquearemos reglones de niveles subsiguientes.

El sistema de física de [b][i]TransPlan[/i][/b] es bastante sólido. No veremos en ningún momento que bajo el mismo escenario y circunstancias obtendremos resultados distintos, esto le otorga confiabilidad al motor del juego y por tanto no sentiremos que es injusto desde sus mecánicas.

La curva de dificultad es sumamente sencilla, y si llegamos a sentir que esta se eleva más allá de nuestras capacidades tendremos la opción de pedirle a la interfaz que nos arroje una pista; estas, sin embargo, existen en forma de contadores y son limitadas, su manera de obtenerlas es mediante la compleción de niveles.

[b][i]TransPlan[/i][/b] posee además un sistema de logros integrado que podremos visualizar en el menú principal, dicha característica le añade un sentido de progreso a pesar de su carente rejugabilidad, ya que el título no da ningún incentivo para seguir jugando una vez hayamos realizado todo los objetivos que nos plantea en cada uno de sus niveles.

[h1]De recomendación casual[/h1]
Quienes tengan afición hacia los puzles y juegos de lógica con mecánicas de física, [b][i]TransPlan[/i][/b] ofrece una experiencia casual con una línea de dificultad que en ningún momento se vuelve frustrante. El juego no hace nada excepcionalmente bueno, pero su concepto minimalista hace de su estética y sus sólidas mecánicas una experiencia agradable e incuestionablemente disfrutable para quienes aprecian el género.

优点：
+ 有趣的谜题设计
+ 提示点数多
+

缺点：
- 流程不长，不支持关卡编辑器
-

《TransPlan》是一款基于物理法则的解谜游戏，通过运用简单的力学原理把蓝色方块运到目的地的游戏。画风简介音乐轻快，并能随时储存进度，非常适合打发时间。

从始至终游戏都保持着较低的难度，不仅在于它规则的简单，更在于它宽松的步数判定与富余的提示点数。许多要求7,8步完成的谜题实际上2,3步就完成的情况并不罕见，所以想拿全成就也不怎么困难。事实上，如果前期节省一点使用提示点数的话，到了最后的大师关卡怎么说也能剩下40点左右，接下来不停使用提示无脑通关就行了。

总之，轻松愉快的解谜小游戏，适合全体人群随时玩一把，，，尤其适合拖延症犯了的时候。

坑爹的steam。。。新的掉卡规则搞得全成就了卡还没掉一张，玩完了之后还得继续挂着。。。

17718801.review:
Good and relatively quick game to 100% for achievements. 

TransPlan is a simple physics-based puzzle game that reminded me of classics like 'The Incredible Machine.' Each level has a par number of moves you can score under, at, or over. If you are having trouble with any puzzles, "hint tokens," which you earn by beating levels, can be redeemed to show you how to start (or if you use a lot of tokens, finish) whatever puzzle you'd like. 

All in all, this is a pretty non-threatening and casual puzzle game, which isn't to say that all the puzzles are easy, but it never manages to get frustrating. For the asking price of $2-$3 dollars, you're looking at roughly a dollar per hour of gameplay, and you can certainly do much worse than that.

[게임의 장점]
1. 손으로 그린 깔끔한 디자인
2. 1문제 해결시 주어지는 힌트로 인한 적절한 난이도 조절 기능

4. 게임 업데이트 (2015년 7월 업데이트로 인한 마스터 레벨 2 - 10문제 생김) 


[게임의 아쉬운 점]
1. 단축키의 부재
2. 깔끔한 메뉴이나 한번에 볼 수 없어 다른 메뉴 이동시 약간 불편함.


[게임소개]
 : 물리적인 법칙(물건을 건드려 떨어트린다던가 압정을 고정시켜 기울인다던가의 행위)을 이용한 간단한 퍼즐로 물체를 목적지까지 이동시키는 것이 목적임


간단한 도구(압정 : 물체 고정, 지우개 : 물체 지우기)를 이용하며 또한 물리적인 법칙을 이용한 퍼즐로 목적지까지 물건을 옮기면 되는 간단한 퍼즐게임임.

노트에 직접 그린 그래픽으로 매우 깔끔하고 정감가는 느낌이 들어 오히려 게임의 집중도를 높이는 역활을 했다고 생각된다. 또한 초반 게임진행시 주어지는 초급 퍼즐로 인해 쉽게 게임 방식을 습득할 수 있으며 중급, 고급, 마스터 단계로 가면서 다양한 해결 방법을 통해 퍼즐을 해결 해야 하는데 간단한 도구와 물리적인 법칙을 활용한 다양한 방법을 통해 문제를 해결할때 마다 창의적인 아이디어를 생각하게끔 유도한다는 점에서 나름 잘 만들어진 퍼즐 게임이 아닐까 싶다.
 
또한 7월 9일 마스터2(10문제)가 새로 업데이트 되면서 이전 마스터1 단계까지 모두 클리어 하는데 걸리는 시간이 1~2시간 내외로 아쉬웠는데 이러한 문제가 조금은 해결되지 않았나 싶다.
그리고 문제를 해결할 때마다 주어지는 힌트로 인해 마스터 단계에 도달하게 되면 힌트가 너무 많이 남아 조금만 어려워지면 힌트를 남발하게 되는 경우가 발생되는데, 마스터2가 업데이트 됨에 따라 보다 더욱 문제가 어려워졌기에 힌트를 남발하게 되어 게임의 재미가 급 반감되는 단점도 약간은 해소되지 않았나 싶다.

그리고 발매일 이후 7월에 마스터2 단계가 업데이트 된 것으로 보아 이후에도 추가적인 문제가 업데이트 될 수 있을거란 기대감이 있으며 2.99 달러의 금액이 전혀 아깝지 않을거라 충분히 보장할 수 있을거 같다.

마지막으로 도전과제 100% 달성도 크게 어렵지 않으니 퍼즐을 좋아한다면 TransPlan 게임을 구매하여 즐겨보길 권한다.

17060783.review:
[b]TransPlan[/b] was a very pleasant surprise! This is one of Steam's "bargain bin" games, when something is being sold for [b]£0.39[/b] in a sale, you don't really jump into the game with high expectations, but this turned out to be a brilliant purchase! 

[b]TransPlan[/b] is a physics puzzle game, reminicent of the old [b]The Incredible Machine[/b] series, except instead of having hundreds of ludicrous gadgets and tools at your disposal, you simply get an eraser and some thumb tacks to complete the puzzles. It is a very simple concept, but it's so beautifully done. 
The mechanics of this game are very easy to learn and there is a perfect difficulty curve as you progress through the levels, things don't really get all that challenging until you reach the expert stages though, some of the master levels will leave you scratching your heads for quite a while if you chose not to use the hints feature. 

So without a doubt I would recommend [b]TransPlan[/b] to any puzzle fans, at such a low cost which gets even lower in the Steam sales, it's a steal. On top of that, it's a very fun game to try and 100% too when you're in that "I don't know what to play" mood. Pick this up when it goes on sale, you won't regret it.

17029155.review:
I really want to give this game a good review.  I did enjoy certain puzzles where there was a rube goldberg type of chaining going on, but unfortunately the negatives outweigh the positives for me.  That said, I'm really rather neutral on the game but wanted to put this as a negative review so that people know that there are serious flaws and it's not simply a "Brilliant physics puzzler" as the top review currently states.

Pros:
+ fun art style and music
+ when it works it works well and can be quite satisfying.  there were a couple puzzles which just came together beautifully and I even replayed those levels to see it again.

Cons:
- Outcomes are nondeterministic: If you do the same exact thing twice, you WILL get different results.  Often those results are the difference between a solution working and not working.  In a physics puzzler, this is an absolutely HUGE deal.  Likewise, the Undo doesn't completely revert to the previous state and will often leave you in a slightly in-between-moves state.  This means a lot of redoing to get something that works which makes it feel like you're cheesing your solution.  You can also exploit the broken Undo to get a solution that would otherwise not be possible.
- The physics are based on actual physics, so there's gravity and momentum, but there are noticeable gaps where things don't behave according to how you'd expect.  The most jarring for me was a solution that required you to exploit the wonky physics to make one rectangular block turn while another square block flips to stay on top of the rectangular turning block.  That was the only time I used a hint in the game and it left quite a bitter taste.  Outside of that one puzzle, it's more quibbles than actual annoyances.
- The menu system is absolutely terrible: there's about ten different tabs for different puzzles but you have to navigate between them in really odd non-intuitive ways and can't access a single list.  it tries to be nonlinear and give the player options, but really is just confusing.  You can't just select 'next puzzle' from the main menu and it doesn't remember what you were working on last so you have to find it in the maze of options.

Neutral:
* Very short: about two hours total with the newly released Master II puzzles.  But it's cheap, so I won't fault it for this.
* The vast majority of the puzzles are trivial tutorial-esque puzzles that hand-hold you though the solution.  Only a few will require more than a couple minutes to work through.  Of the puzzles that are nontrivial, about half of them require guessing or trial-and-error to find what esoteric solution the designer thought would be really difficult to figure out (it is and it's not fun).  The other half are the good ones where you can concoct a plan, have that plan mostly work or mostly fail, tweak things, and finally achieve your goal.  It winds up feeling more like "what did the developer expect me to do?" than "what can I figure out that will work?".

Overall, I'd say it's a solid 5/10.  If it was deterministic, I'd give it a 7/10.  A bit more of the fun puzzles would be an easy 9.

青い四角形を目標地点に移動させるのが目的の物理演算パズルゲーム。
配置された図形を画鋲と消しゴムでいじくり回して
斜面や振り子を作り、うまく誘導していく。

紙に描かれた風味のメイン画面、心地良いSE、しっとりしたBGMが

16840235.review:
Great little puzzle game in the vein of Inside the Gear, but not crap. The idea is to move an object from A -> B using the various objects in the field to swing it, catapult it, hit it, drop it etc... You only have 2 tools to play with, drawing pins to keep elements in place or allow them to pivot around a certain point and an eraser to remove elements altogether so they don't get in the way.

The physics are pretty good, results are consistent not random, though the undo button can be a little buggy, producing strange results. There are 80 levels and one criticism might that the first 70 are really only tutorials to introduce all the elements you'll need for the last 10. Should only take you about 2 hours as it's not really all that difficult, but it's still a great experience.

한판한판 깔끔하고 짧게 끝나는 미션들이 소소한 성취감을 주구요.

16442224.review:
TransPlan is a puzzle-simulator game with a fun 'doodle' appearance. 

The game uses basic physics of gravity and collisions, and you are tasked with getting the blue item to the end position. While not particularly difficult, it does provide challenges by tasking you to complete levels 'under par'. This coupled with 'pins' lets you find very unique solutions to each puzzle. It's particularly rewarding when you manage to get the game to produce a result in a very small number of moves.

The music and appearance match the difficulty, being very light-hearted, and if you ever get stuck you can use 'hints' to show you where to get started on a level. I do feel as if the game provides a bit too much help though, as if you keep asking for more hints it will essentially solve the level for you.

Not particularly difficult, but fun nonetheless.

물리 법칙을 적극 활용한 퍼즐들이 마음에 든다. 난이도도 어렵지 않은 편이니, 물리에 대해 일면식 없는 문과 분들이라도 어렵지 않게 플레이할 수 있을 것이다. 한 판을 깰 때마다 힌트가 한개씩 주어지니, 힌트도 넉넉한 편. 이 힌트 사용에 제약도 없어 못 풀겠다 싶은 판이 있으면 주저없이 힌트를 쓰자. 이동횟수가 8회라면, 총 8번 모두 힌트를 열 수 있다. 물론 남은 힌트가 충분하다면 말이지.

뿐만 아니라, 꼭 파란색 목표 지점에 파란색 네모/원을 꼭 맞게 넣지 않아도 된다. 얼추 겹치는 부분이 조금 있어도 판정이 넉넉해서 전부 성공취급 되어버린다. 야매 풀이에 대단히 관대한 편. 심지어 도전과제 하나 열려면 이 야매를 적극 활용해야 한다. 남들에겐 엉터리로 보일 지 모르겠지만, 내게는 재미있게 느껴졌던 부분.

게임의 가격이 싸고, 그만큼 컨텐츠도 적으니 게임이 금방 끝난다.
본인같은 도전과제 사냥꾼들에겐 그야말로 최적의 게임.

16291243.review:
TransPlan is a very enjoyable puzzle/physics game at a very enjoyable price. If you have a penchant for this sort of game, this is definately one NOT to be missed.

The goal is to cause one geometric shape to be delivered to the same spot as another shape, locked in place (so far at least.) This is done by a combination of manipulating the moving shape, as well as other shapes, using the force of gravity. Shapes are manipulated by using pins, much in the manner of Crayon Physics Deluxe, or by erasing. Perhaps other means further on, and some of the shapes fall into sometimes partially controllable PILES of shapes. It can be somewhat complex, and so far the number of suggested necessary movements has gone as high as eight. The "reset" and "undo" buttons will be well used, and should be, without shame. I've had fun failing deliberately, just to watch gravity at work. (If you have a touch screen this game is a little piece of heaven! VERY well thought out.) 

So far I've just passed the 40 puzzle mark, apparently of 70. Nothing is crazy-frustrating, and in fact can be fairly easily accomplished, though without the feeling of being a gift. (I've returned to a few, rather than become frustrated.) There is thought required for success, and since many can be solved below "par" (basically under "budget", or in less than the suggested number of movements) there is an additional challenge that can be quite a bit more interesting, even after initial completion. (I've come in as much as 5 below, on a 7-movement puzzle, and there are two achievements to recognize that very thing.) The map is well conceived, as is the process of becoming eligible to access certain puzzles and groups of puzzles. At any time there may be numerous puzzles available for consideration, grouped into categories such as "catapult" and "sling" (my personal favorite!)

Don't expect this to be Crayon Physics Deluxe, and at this wonderful price and degree of accessibility, it shouldn't be. Every puzzle solved has given me a nice feeling of accomplishment, without the frustration so often a game-ending part of the journey. Since I am in no way an engineer, I am grateful for this really fun, well designed game with a very well conceived learning curve. And the DEVs will respond quickly, sometimes within minutes. For me, that can be the BEST feature in a game.

(4mdt, puzzle pro)

16268086.review:
For £1.99 with a -25% deal, I am happy with the product I bought, it is a good deal for a fun game!

So what is TransPlan? Well, basically it involves in problem solving, physics and at times, restarting. You need to get a blue solid shape into a transpart blue box to go to the next level, The tutorial is done pretty well and it tells you what you need to do, making the game easy to understand in about five-ten minutes. You will need to use your brain for this one in order to make it to the blue transpart box wich usually involves in restarting. You learn from your mistakes. Physics is pretty heavy in this game and it is pretty much what the game is based on.

The game generally looks as if someone drew it at school, it also has pins and rubbers that you can use to progress to the next level as those will be needed. It seems as if they designed this to be for kids, but that is my opinion only.

The options, I honestly would say it is a bit bare. You get three options: Music, Sounds and Full Screen. You can turn these  on and off if you wish. But it seems like it is lacking more in depth options, for example you can't choose the resolution of the game, you can only make it full-screen or not. I think there should also be a brightness setting, The game does feel a little too bright for me, so maybe having that option wouldn't be bad. The sounds and music you can't really adjust, it would be nice to have a slider to make it easier.

There seem to be plenty of levels that I believe are worth it's value, you can also go back to these if you wish and get the "par" for all of these, which is basically nailing the level with as minimum moves as you can. They also added achivements too, 17 to date of this writing. Which makes the experience so much better, I personally am an achivement hunter. :D 

Also the sound track, it feels comfortable and relaxing, when you're playing through the levels you don't really feel any stress when you fail a try because the soundtrack keeps that from happening, it is smoothing and calm.

So would I recommend this game? Yes, I would. I believe the value of this game is great, I think the levels, the soundtrack and plot of the game are great. So I would indeed recommend this game. Good job at the people at Kittehface Software, This is one game where you have my approval for it.

40522750.review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un jeu de puzzle basé sur la physique. Dessin typé crayon à papier, ça rends pas mal. Pour ce qui est des puzzles, le but est de déplacer un bloc bleu sur un emplacement bleu. Pour ça, on est armés d'une gomme (effacer un bloc), de punaises (le faire tenir en place, il va tourner autour de la punaise si on applique une force dessus), et simplement de la possibilité de toucher les blocs, ce qui les fait tomber à la verticale.

Les outils sont simples, il n'y a pas vraiment beaucoup de blocs différents (standards, lourds, innamovibles), tout se joue sur la physique : blocs ronds qui roulent et poussent avec la vitesse, catapultes diverses et variées, ...

Le jeu est vraiment orienté casual. Sur tous les puzzles, seuls deux ou trois m'ont vraiment donné à réfléchir. Comptez entre 3 et 4h de jeu pour le terminer à un rythme tranquille.

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Les achievements sont activés en terminant les niveaux. Il y en a deux pour terminer les niveaux sous le par de 1 et 3, mais on peut faire bien plus sur certains niveaux :).

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Un petit puzzle basé sur la physique orienté casual. Recommandé !

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, je n'ai rencontré aucun problème.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.
